item.title: The Divine Duality: Understanding the Sacred Balance of Good and Evil
item.description:
The Paradox of Divine Responsibility

A profound theological question emerges:

  • Humans blame dark forces for suffering
  • Dark forces can only blame Absolute God
  • If God is the ultimate source of all creation…
  • Then both light and darkness originate from the Divine

This leads us to a fundamental realization:

“As water is needed, so is the need for fire; as good is needed, so is the need for evil. Good and evil are complementary.”
